result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Byron Keith D Brown Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Byron Keith D Brown Jr in court.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Byron Keith D Brown Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance. Adj for discovery and position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Byron Keith D Brown Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def referred to SPD (slip provided).  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. 
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Def called to req hearing on 9-12-22 be conducted by Zoom due to his school schedule; he was informed case is a felony and personal appearance is required.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Byron Keith D Brown Jr in court. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Court sets $100 cash bond, previously posted.  Def plans to retain private counsel.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear w/attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
22R 001996 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #14199 on 1-27-22
Initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
